startup_analysis.initialization_notes: Game initializes with pygame-ce, creates window (800x600), loads font, and creates 4 game levels with obstacles, collectibles, and exit portals.

basic_functionality_tests.description: Game window created successfully with title 'Vector Ball Physics'
Main game loop runs at 60 FPS
Circular ball with blue color rendered at starting position
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Ball visible on screen with physics properties

basic_functionality_tests.description: Euler integration with gravity (0.15), friction (0.995), and restitution (0.75)
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Ball responds to forces and collisions

basic_functionality_tests.description: Static rectangular obstacles and moving hazards implemented
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Obstacles collide with ball, hazards reset ball and deduct score

basic_functionality_tests.description: Yellow pulsing dots that give +10 points when collected
Green pulsing portal that advances to next level
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Reaching portal adds score and loads next level
Levels progress from simple to complex with more obstacles and moving hazards

basic_functionality_tests.description: Score and level indicator displayed on screen
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Text shows current score and level number

basic_functionality_tests.description: Arrow keys and WASD for movement, ESC to quit
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Continuous input applies directional force to ball

basic_functionality_tests.description: Overlay displayed when all levels complete
basic_functionality_tests.expected_behavior: Shows final score with restart option (SPACE key)

stability_analysis.notes: Application ran for full 2-minute test period without crashes or errors.

strengths: Clean physics implementation with Vector2 class
Proper separation of concerns (Ball, Obstacle, Collectible, ExitPortal classes)
observations: Uses pygame-ce (community edition) instead of pygame
Proper wall collision handling with restitution

specifications_compliance.action_space: Continuous force vector via WASD/Arrow keys - MATCHES
specifications_compliance.how_to_stop: ESC key or kill process - WORKING

conclusion: The Vector Ball Physics application successfully starts, initializes all game components, and runs stably. All basic features including player ball, obstacles, collectibles, exit portals, level progression, and UI rendering are functional. The physics engine works correctly with gravity, friction, and collision handling. The application is ready for gameplay and RL agent integration.
